column16: Notes
Is nothing, does not even occupy space in the petal orbit.
Any health healed over maximum gets converted to shield. Stacks additively. If Roses or Dahlias are equipped, they will comtinue to heal at full HP.
Only works when laid down. Upon being destroyed (includes the player dying) or the petal being unequipped, the flower teleports back to where the petal was and the petal goes on respawn.
Does not orbit the user, instead appears on their head. This change is visible in the UI at the top left. Grants a bonus to the user's FoV. Does not stack.

5 commons are provided upon for free when first playing. Common basics can't be crafted. If slots are left empty when starting, they will automatically be filled with common basics. Basics can't be absorbed.
Increases all healing received from yourself or other players. Does not interact with mobs. See Statuses for info on healing received.

Releases a lightning attack when an enemy or projectile makes contact with the flower. Stacks. Lightning can bounce to nearby enemies up to the indicated number of times by the bounce stat. All entities struck by it have their velocity set to 0 for an instant. Does not interact with mobs.
Petal has armor. See Statuses for info on armor.
Upon defending, boosts your flower in the direction opposite the bubble is facing. Petal goes on respawn afterward.
Makes all mobs that can be aggressive within a close range aggressive toward you
Decreases armor upon hitting an enemy. Does not stack, though repeated hits will resert the duration. See Statuses for info on armor.

Increases the max health of the user. Stacks.
Health is increased (or decreased when unequipped) in such a way so that the percentage of health stays the same. 
Ex. Equipping a legendary cactus at 50% health gives the user 40 HP.
Upon attacking, shoots in a straight line away from the flower. If it hits a wall or mob, it will bounce off of it.

Deals more damage on top of base damage, as determined by the extra damage stat, if the target is above 80% health. Otherwise deals base damage. Damage is reduced by 50% versus flowers. Base damage is calculated after extra damage.

Increases the luck stat, doesn't stack individually but stacks if multiple people use it. Doesn't work in PvP.
Luck increases the rarity of mobs that spawn around you. Luck caps out at 4 for an area.
Points to the nearest ultra mob. The ultra variant of this petal will instead point to a magnet if one is nearby, though the super version will not do this.
N/A
Negates all incoming damage, causing damage to go to the petal instead.
Does not orbit the user, instead appear on their flower. This change is visible in the UI at the top left. Grants a bonus to the user's body damage. Does not stack.

Does not extend upon attacking.
If the user or a nearby player (PvE) is not at full health, the rose gets absorbed by that player and goes on respawn. 
Heal stat is for each individual petal.

Upon attacking, shoots in a straight line away from the flower. Enemies it hits have their healing received reduced by 20% for the duration listed. Stacks multiplicatively. Flowers hit by this turn a pale yellow.
If there are multiple petals, petals do not occupy the same spot, instead forming a line of petals. This decreases the distance between petals.
Cannot go through walls. See Statuses for info on healing received.

Has a 5% chance of dealing 35 times the normal damage. % chance of 35 times damage increases by 0.4% for every 0.1 extra luck (from clovers).
Randomly changes appearance from 1 to 6 pips
Does not orbit the user, instead appear on their flower. This change is visible in the UI at the top left. Reduces incoming body damage. Does not stack.

Spawns four friendly soldier ants that will follow the user and attack nearby non-stationary mobs or enemy flowers. It cannot damage the user or flowers in PvE. They are still able to interact with the friendly mob, pushing it around. Enemy mobs will act hostile toward friendly mobs. Friendly mobs appear yellow instead of their normal color. The petal's health bar will reflect the friendly mob's health. Summoned mobs can damage other summoned mobs from non-squad members.
Cannot go through walls. When an egg is hatched, it does not occupy space in the flower's orbit.
column17:
Ant Egg
Fire Ant Egg
Queen Ant
Queen Fire Ant
Termite Egg

column16:
Spawns a friendly beetle that will follow the user and attack nearby non-stationary mobs or enemy flowers. It cannot damage the user or flowers in PvE. They are still able to interact with the friendly mob, pushing it around. Enemy mobs will act hostile toward friendly mobs. Friendly mobs appear yellow instead of their normal color. The petal's health bar will reflect the friendly mob's health. Summoned mobs can damage other summoned mobs from non-squad members.
Cannot go through walls. When an egg is hatched, it does not occupy space in the flower's orbit.
A portion of the damage this petal deals heals the flower.

Increases the speed at which petals rotate around the user. Stacks with other fasters.
1 rad ≈ 57.3°
2π rad = 1 revolution
Moves erratically in its orbit, wildly jumping in and out.

Upon attacking, splits off in 4 directions at 90 degree angles, moving in a straight line away from their release point. The grapes' orientation does not effect the direction it moves.
Health of the projectile is 1/4 the health of the petal as a whole. Petal and projectiles poison enemy upon contact for 11/15 of a second.
Cannot go through walls. Destroyed by walls if shot.
See Statuses for info on poison.

Slows down petal rotation speed, stacking with other heavies
Does not fully extend upon attacking, extending only partially. Does not contract upon defending. Can push opponents around, even pushing stationary mobs (except Ant Holes).
When near an enemy mob, it will retreat from its orbit toward the enemy, dragging adjacent petals with it. It will stick to this enemy until the enemy dies, the petal dies or the user is far away from the enemy.

Shoots out upon attack or defend. Mobs at or below the rarity specified by the petal will prioritize attacking the laid down honey if nearby, doing so until the honey is destroyed or the honey disappears after a short duration. When destroyed, the petal goes on respawn. Not effective on projectile mobs (excluding Scorpions).
Cannot go through walls.

Deals poison damage over 3 seconds. 
See Statuses for info on poison.
Upon contact, repels whatever it touched by the knockback distance, with the strength decreasing the further one is away from the petal.

Heals the user at a constant rate (usage respawn doesn't apply to this). Stacks with other healing petals.
If a nearby friendly mob (excluding diggers), is not at full health, the leaf gets absorbed by that mob, heals them and goes on respawn.
column17:
Baby Ant
Worker Ant
Centipede (Green)
Leafbug

column16:
If there are multiple petals, petals do not occupy the same spot, instead forming a line of petals. This decreases the distance between petals.
Goes out further than other petals upon attacking.
column17:
Ladybug
Baby Ant
Baby Fire Ant

column16:
Activates upon contact with enemy mobs or flowers, then goes on respawn. Can bounce to nearby enemies up to the indicated number of times by the bounce stat. All entities struck by it have their velocity set to 0 for an instant.
If it attacks a player with a Magnet equipped, it will damage the magnet instead of them.
Negates all poison damage, causing damage to go to the petal instead
Increases the range at which the user collects petals. Does not stack. Effect is not active if petal is on cooldown or in PvP.
Goes on top of any nearby dead player (not in PvP). After the secondary timer has elapsed, this player is sent to hel, a special PvP arena where hel beetles spawn. Petal goes on respawn afterward.

Upon attacking, shoots in a straight line away from the flower.
Mythic+ missile can change its angle slightly to target nearby entities.
Cannot go through walls. Destroyed by walls if shot.
Has 3 petals that form a large triangle in their orbit.

column14:
Shoots - Lays Down.
If already laid down, repelled by the player if nearby. Follows the player if far away.
column15: None. Returns to the player if laid down.
column16:
Upon attacking, goes outward for a short distance before stopping in place. The user can cause the petal to return to them by defending or by going far enough away if neutral. The petal does not return if attacking, though it will start to follow the user if they get far enough. Getting too close while attacking pushes the petal away. If the petal is too far away (by getting caught behind a wall), it will go on respawn.
Cannot go through walls.

Upon attacking, splits off in 4 directions at 90 degree angles, moving in a straight line away from their release point. The peas' orientation does not effect the direction it moves.
Health of the projectile is 1/4 the health of the petal as a whole.
Cannot go through walls. Destroyed by walls if shot.

Inflicts poison damage and slows down enemies it hits.
See Statuses for info on poison. Poison rate differs slightly per rarity with the poison damage being dished out over the entire length of the duration stat.
Duration determines slowdown time. Slowdown is by 80% and stacks with webs. Shells are immune to the slowdown effect, high rarity mobs resist it.
Damage against projectiles is increased by 20x.

Upon attacking, petals move outward as normal but drop in place instead of continuing to rotate around the flower. The petals will also spread out a bit.
Upon defending, the same occurs but the petals move inward and get closer to each other.
If there are multiple petals, petals do not occupy the same spot, instead forming a line of petals. This decreases the distance between petals.
Decreases mob aggro range on you when equipped. Does not stack.
Doubles base movement speed. Doesn't stack. Goes on respawn if the flower takes damage, if a mob higher than the desginated rarity is nearby or a player is nearby in PvP (roughly normal FoV range)
Does not orbit the user, instead makes the user appear reddish. If the user takes damage, all other nearby relic users take a percentage of the damage too, spreading it out.
column17:
Baby Termite
Soldier Termite
Worker Termite
Termite Overmind
Termite Mound

column16: The petal needs time to move from the flower to its orbit, reducing its practical DPS.
N/A
Increases armor if the flower is defending. See Statuses for info on armor. Does not interact with mobs. Does not stack.
If the user or a nearby player (PvE) is not at full health, the rose gets absorbed by that player, heals them and goes on respawn.

Increases knockback from collisions, pushing the player away from the attack. This stacks additively.
Also reduces damage taken from lightning by 20%. This stacks multiplicativaly.

If a mob or flower damages the user (damaging a shell's shield or a magnet doesn't count), they take a percentage of that damage too. Stacks with other salts additively. Damage reflected back at flowers is 25% that of mobs. Damage reflection is disabled if Sponge is used simultaneously. Damage reflection shown is for mobs.
N/A

Grants a shield when absorbed by the user or a nearby player, at which point it goes on respawn. The shield is in addition to normal health and serves as extra HP. All incoming damage applies to the shield before the player. The shield slowly decays while active. The shell will always favor the person with a lower shield when deciding who to get absorbed by. The shield's decay rate is correlated with the shield's HP, meaning a higher shield value decays faster.
The shield is not considered healing, and as such, still works under the influence of a dandelion but is not affected by the medic skill.
Turns the user invincible and untargetable (indicated by a grey outline), but disables all petals and slows movement speed upon activation. Does not stack.

Increases the max health of the user and increases the petal orbital distance but makes their hitbox larger and decreases movement speed. Petal orbit is changed in such a way so that the distance the petals are from the flower remains the same. Stacks.
Orbital distance, hitbox and movement speed changes are the same no matter the petal's rarity.
Health is increased (or decreased when unequipped) in such a way so that the percentage of health stays the same. 
Each soil petal increases size by 3 units with the base size being 9 units.
Reduces the effect of pulling from ultra+ sandstorms.
Disables flower collisions for the user near portals.

Absorbs all incoming damage to the flower. This damage is dealt over time as designated by the period stat. If the petal is unequipped, all damage yet to be dealt is dealt instantly. Doesn't stack, though all sponges must die for damage to be dealt instantly.

Spawns as an ally square mob of equal rarity. 
Cannot go through walls.
Heals the user at a constant rate but only if the user is below 75% HP.  Stacks with other healing petals.

Spawns a friendly sandstorm every few seconds as determined by the Usage Respawn value (petal must be alive). These sandstorms have normal sandstorm AI (can't be aggressive). Can spawn a maximum of 2 sandstorms. If the petal dies, its respective sandstorms die. Sandstorms die after losing all their health or after 45 seconds. Summoned mobs can damage other summoned mobs from non-squad members.
Cannot go through walls.
N/A
Some of the damage dealt by the petal is dealt to the user
Gives the user a chance of not taking damage from an attack. Does not work on poison or lightning. Stacks multiplicatively.

Does not orbit the user, instead appears on their flower. This change is visible in the UI at the top left. Petals expand further out upon attack, even petals which don't normally extend. Does not stack.
Upon spawning, deals the minimum damage. However, after three seconds, it deals maximum damage and stays there. The petal size also grows over time, signifying how much damage it will deal.

Damages all hostile flowers and mobs and the user in a large radius (extends past the standard FoV) every second, with damage decreasing the further from the petal the entity is (the user takes the full damage). Damage is dealt through poison over the course of a second. Does not stack. See Statuses for info on poison.
Turns all mobile mobs aggressive (except sandstorm and bubble), even ones that normally can't be, if they were passive before.

Upon attacking, shoots in a straight line away from the flower for a short distance before stopping and laying down a web on the ground. Upon defending, the petal lays a web on the ground where it is. The web slows down hostile mobs (except Spiders and Shells, and high rarity mobs are partially resistant) and flowers that wander over it by 75%, not stacking with other webs. Once a web is laid down, the petal goes on respawn, allowing each web petal to accumulate multiple webs on the ground. Webs don't deal damage once on the ground.
Cannot go through walls.
Upon attacking, moves away from the flower before going back in, effectively increasing the petal's range.
column17:
Firefly
Fly
Moth
Soldier Ant
Soldier Fire Ant
Queen Ant
Queen Fire Ant

column16: Automatically revives any dead players nearby (not in PvP), putting them at the specified HP. Petal goes on respawn afterward.
Changes petal rotation patterns based on the number equipped, attempting to group petals into clumps
Heals the user at a constant rate but only if the user is defending. Stacks with other healing petals.
column17:
Baby Fire Ant
Worker Fire Ant
Soldier Fire Ant

column16: Heals the user at a constant rate but only if the user is defending. Stacks with other healing petals.
